name: "Zorro": Phantom of the Night Quiz | Zorro | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the pueblo where "Zorro" takes place?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	Diego calls the pueblo Los Angeles in the third episode "Water". This is the first time we hear the name of the pueblo or see the sign. Diego asks Felipe why anyone would want to leave Los Angeles.

questions.text: In a weak moment on "Honor Thy Father", to whom did Don Diego divulge his secret of Zorro?
questions.explanation:
Alejandro De La Vega.

	Don Diego thought a good son wouldn't keep secrets from his father so on Don Alejandro's sick bed, Diego told him the truth. After Alejandro recovered in part to Zorro's help, he told Diego about the dream he had that Diego was Zorro. Alejandro laughed at the thought.

questions.text: Felipe's mother returned to take Felipe home with her in "Family Business".
questions.explanation:
False.

	The story of Felipe's arrival at the De La Vega hacienda was recounted by Diego in this episode. Diego found Felipe after his parent's had supposedly been killed in an attack. The attack was so traumatic for Felipe that he lost his voice. When Felipe left with his mother, Diego learned from Victoria that Felipe had actually been kidnapped for ransom.

questions.text: What was the sure thing in the "Zorro" episode "The Sure Thing"?
questions.explanation:
Horse.

	The sure thing was a horse named Zeus who had been nursed to health from a broken leg. He was poisoned during a race and the poison slowed him down. The blacksmith gave Zeus something to counteract the poison in his system and Zeus lived. Zorro was challenged to a race by the same man with the stake being Tornado. Zorro won the race and exposed the man as the one who poisoned Zeus.

questions.text: In "Dead Men Tell No Tales", who did the Alcalde arrest for murder to get Zorro to come out of hiding?
questions.explanation:
Victoria Escalante.

	The Alcalde knew that Zorro would come out of hiding if he was aware that Victoria needed him. Alcalde Ramon had an actor friend come to the pueblo to play the part of a dead man. When Victoria was arrested for his murder, Zorro came out of hiding to reveal the dead man was not really dead.

questions.text: Who, unknowingly, gave Don Diego the idea for Zorro in "The Legend Begins"?
questions.explanation:
Sergeant Mendoza.

	While in the tavern in "The Legend Begins", Don Diego was listening to Sergeant Mendoza tell his soldiers about Indians that would appear out of the night and attack them. Sergeant Mendoza told Diego it wasn't the Indians he was afraid of or even the dark; it was the unknown.

questions.text: In the four part episode "The Legend Begins", Felipe and Diego found Zorro a wild horse roaming the countryside. What did Felipe suggest they call Zorro's horse?
questions.explanation:
Tornado.

	When Diego and Felipe found the horse, he was protecting his colt. Diego was able to help the colt and win the trust of the horse. When they got back to the house, Felipe suggested they call the horse Tornado because he was fast like the storm.  Tornado is Spanish for tornadoHuracan is Spanish for hurricaneSalvaje is Spanish for wildTormenta is Spanish for storm

questions.text: During the episode "Whereabouts", did the writer Sebastian Moreno figure out Zorro's real identity?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sebastian Moreno was an accomplished writer who had come to Los Angeles to reveal Zorro's real identity and write about him. After speaking with several people in the pueblo, Moreno decided to return home and write that he knew Zorro's real identity without divulging it. Diego realized the Alcalde would never let Moreno leave without knowing the truth about Zorro and followed Moreno out of the pueblo.Zorro was there to protect Moreno when he was attacked. Moreno saved Zorro from being shot. When Zorro took Moreno to safety, he asked Moreno to reveal Zorro's true identity. Moreno simply said, "You're Zorro".

questions.text: In "An Explosive Situation", while tied up and waiting for a barrel of gunpowder to explode, what did Diego dream would happen in his life?
options: He could give up the life as Zorro
Everyone would come to look upon him as a brave man
Victoria would love him as Diego and not as Zorro
questions.explanation:
He didn't dream at all.

	Diego, Sergeant Mendoza, Alejandro, Victoria and Alcalde Ramon were tied up in Victoria's tavern and left to die. While they watched the fuse pass them, Victoria dreamed that Zorro took her away from the pueblo and Sergeant Mendoza dreamed that he defeated Zorro. The Alcalde dreamed that he had been promoted. Diego was able to extinguish the flame when it passed him by knocking a bottle over on the flame. Everyone praised Diego for saving their lives.

questions.text: The meaning of Zorro was mentioned in several episodes. What is the English meaning of Zorro's name?
questions.explanation:
Fox.

	Felipe found a fox in the cave behind the fireplace. He had come in through the secret door. The fox gave Diego the idea for the name of his alternate identity.
